clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Art Therapy on Reducing Pain and Anxiety in Children Receiving Venipuncture
clinical_study.official_title: The Effectiveness of Art Therapy on Reducing Pain and Anxiety in Children Receiving Venipuncture in a Pediatric Department: A Randomized Controlled Trial

brief_summary.textblock:
Venipuncture is one of the most common stressful procedures in children. Managing pain and fear of venipuncture procedure recommended strongly because it may change children's memory for procedural pain and the subsequent acceptance of later health care painful interventions. Prior painful experiences can reduce the acceptance of later health care, hence making it more difficult for both patients and nurses.
There was clear evidence that the distraction method is the most performed as a psychological technique performed to decrease venipuncture-related pain and distress and supporting its efficacy in children.
The aim of this study to investigate the effectiveness of TICK-B on children's pain and anxiety during venipuncture procedure.

primary_outcome.description: Wong-Baker faces scale (WBFS). Used to measure the pain severity during the procedure, the WB-FBRS is a series of six cartoon faces positioned side-by-side from the greatest pain to the mildest one (0-5).

secondary_outcome.description: The Childrens Fear Scale (CFS) is used to assess children's fear or anxiety levels. The one-item scale consists of five sex neutral faces arranged from left to right with no fear in the center, through fear out to extreme fear.

other_outcome.measure: Pain and anxiety measured by parents and observe.
other_outcome.description: Visual Analog Scale (VAS) was used to measure the pain and fear of children by parents and observer. A rating of 0 represents no pain and 10 represents the worst or most severe pain. The VAS is a valid, reliable, and frequently used measure of procedural distress in children 6 to 18 years of age.

arm_group.description: Experimental: TICK-B group -Pediatric patients received TICK-B as a distraction in the TICK-B group

arm_group.arm_group_label: Standard care provided group as control group
arm_group.description: -Pediatric patients received standard care (routine care) in the control group.

intervention.intervention_name: Trace Image and Coloring for Kids-Book (TICK-B)
intervention.description: A collection of pictures designed as a book contains and given to children during the procedure and they take a picture as they favored.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- being between 6-12 years old,
- a physician order was placed for the blood sample,
Exclusion Criteria:
- Chronic medical condition.
- Those whose parent not participated,
- Neurodevelopmental delayed, verbal difficulties, difficulties in hearing or visual,
- Unconsciousness.
- Take a medication analgesic in the past 6 hrs.
- history of syncope.
